document.title: Nebraska College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts

B5F3EFCD7129431A977378E3F6E602C6.description: Use appropriate visual and/or digital tools to support verbal communication.

2EC68370288E4AE3AEBD00B80DEAF56A.description: Demonstrate awareness of and sensitivity to the appropriate use of words (e.g., helpful/hurtful words).

268D75542895454D976A83AE40859857.description: Explain the purpose of information being presented.

0B4AC4E5FCAD4AF68957A0FBC0F24CF9.description: Convey a personal perspective with clear reasons.

41405004ED184A24BFF6916558151594.description: Demonstrate appropriate speaking techniques (e.g., appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, clear pronunciation) for a variety of purposes and situations.

80F788616C394BEB9201D397D3C4D066.description: With prompting and support, describe familiar people, places, things, and events, and provide additional detail.

E38344950D8B4D6B95970E38432AB58D.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence in which the organization, development, and style are appropriate to the discipline, audience, and/or context.

9A27F5E3EAD2497D9FB88D26B520C925.description: Participate with peers and adults in structured discussions and routines about 1st grade topics and texts.

FFF7E0E0307048AAAE86D00FB3F7CDFA.description: Complete a task following one/two-step directions.

55186EB1F88C4998829D126EB5E9A2DC.description: Develop attentive listening skills (e.g., eye contact, nonverbal cues, recalling).

C1F46CD37FC2433BA399DF9215F510BD.description: Converse with peers and adults in an all-inclusive manner to foster positive relationships while respecting diverse perspectives.

7146AA8B24C84BF083441E0D39577804.description: Demonstrate interpretation of verbal and non-verbal messages in a conversation.

25841264329547519C324408AFD5A455.description: Ask pertinent questions to acquire or confirm information.

AA191AAB3F8841D1A31C732C13E8B28E.description: With prompting and support, participate with peers and adults in structured discussions and routines about Kindergarten topics and texts.

ACC960344FD741C1AC9D5492CC4309A7.description: Communicate effectively and appropriately in collaborative activities for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences to express ideas, share knowledge, and generate new understandings.

FBD117332F214E628C6B19E97CC0DC14.description: With prompting and support, identify information from provided sources to answer a question using a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

F0B2A981E17448BFA8E9827D0AC6352B.description: With prompting and support, write informative/explanatory pieces about a topic or text with one supporting fact using a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

5FEFB30027304888B8E69BE837904D15.description: With prompting and support, express an opinion about a topic or text with one supporting reason using a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

1AF888BDCBC940D79C4CEA08B9ECE9C4.description: With prompting and support, narrate personal or fictional events in a sequential order using a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

C4306FD047EC4A68A8D5D96C53389D86.description: Write in a variety of modes for a variety of purposes and audiences across disciplines.

12463389D5CE49D5932C89DF296BE4D8.description: Use appropriate digital/multimedia tools to produce, enhance, and/or publish writing individually or with peers.

C1F220681CDB4E39B1B1ECF0FC478E70.description: Use or decipher multiple formats of print and digital text (e.g., manuscript, font, graphics, symbols).

E1387F98C08B47769EF91F9229E682B8.description: Use feedback from others to improve writing and/or add details.

A33C611028E94B0AAB2E2CACC9937960.description: Adapt writing processes to sustain engagement in short and long-term writing tasks of increasing length and complexity.

2A666E0BEEFA4B868FBA45400EC32BDD.description: Use prewriting activities and resources to generate ideas.

C539E51B72554C5EA3354F9FC0A390DB.description: With prompting and support, use a recursive writing process to develop, strengthen, and produce writing appropriate to the discipline, audience, and/or context.

34379323264D46C7BCB6037C17C20AF8.description: Use subject-verb agreement in simple sentences.

A02FAF59258A432E89765FB94FDFA198.description: Form regular plural nouns by adding /s/ or /es/.

78A16270DDA5447F821663E5E8537143.description: Identify nouns (e.g., singular and plural) and simple verbs (e.g., action).

70BF448B4A514D94A1C3B4E29F0F60C1.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

852D02B52D914C75845AFB399AB4ED83.description: With prompting and support, form and use complete simple sentences in shared language activities.

2669B2253EC4416C865CE1BFEEE89BFF.description: Use a recursive writing process to produce clear and coherent writing appropriate to the discipline, audience, and/or context.

EFCFC24E32F04D4E85422C90C3BC97BF.description: Demonstrate understanding that syllables are organized around vowel sounds.

F43EBB5C7E254394AB94D203173A92B1.description: Segment phonemes orally in single-syllable words.

78FE5232B41C4021BA690430BC197F80.description: Write left to right and use appropriate spacing between letters and words.

14946A5ABB8E4BDA9987F3759F47EACD.description: Print many upper and lowercase manuscript letters using reference materials and classroom resources.

4D8DAAADA3A14D968860DAD309BB1B07.description: Identify and match upper and lowercase manuscript letters.

49B920435E4847AF9F05237440870D9A.description: Apply handwriting skills to communicate ideas and information.

8D69E288C61343D4A70BC33D3D974B5E.description: With prompting and support, identify and explain descriptive words and phrases that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

C7B85445FCFB4202AA18E639E207C7A8.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key words and phrases to determine their meaning.

0475501FCCFB44C4A73F188FA75840C9.description: With prompting and support, deepen understanding of words by identifying and relating them to their opposites.

3E1E90766E084A769468A12137B3470B.description: With prompting and support, sort common words and phrases into conceptual categories to develop an understanding of word relationships.

1040B80106454EE891A267A44426FCBF.description: Interpret an author's use of figurative, connotative, and technical language in grade-level literary and informational text.

4162DABA194042168AAAB064D94AEC59.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

488DA6675D6A4E9BB5DE51D576A91E47.description: With prompting and support, determine the meanings of key words and phrases using provided reference materials and classroom resources.

FB87E5E34F04467D8FDAAE5A976F5E05.description: With prompting and support, use commonly occurring inflections and affixes to determine the meaning of unknown words.

D1AC5AF0F5004BFDA828C37C5B749779.description: With prompting and support, identify new meanings of familiar words (e.g., park, ring, fly).

876E947FC6B346CCB10136246ED16A53.description: Recognize and use conversational and grade-level academic vocabulary.

6920F3E744104DA5801CC441E43BAB23.description: Build and use a range of conversational, academic, and discipline-specific grade-level vocabulary and apply to reading, writing, speaking, and listening.

0928A229333A4E8BA6728F8BCA63B229.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

7D9B5EEFFFC041A1A6B1F0C93D18E7AA.description: Read and comprehend complex, grade-level informational texts independently and proficiently.

104FDA591A5E43FB80158E24AEACC644.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

ED7959A0AC29499DBF68BC1426EC1114.description: With prompting and support, make connections between own experiences and other cultures in informational texts.

C9D9E0A2D89F4FD197B6E61C99A38D82.description: With prompting and support, explain the difference between facts and opinions about a topic.

0036C8760A44460E883B35BBEACBF994.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities and differences between two informational texts on the same topic.

E0AA39E71E3C4BCC86747FB5D6D1FE33.description: Citing relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate how an author's perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning of grade-level informational texts.

6CA3506313064B0EB1105BB9BB8291ED.description: With prompting and support, use text features (titles, headings, visuals) to predict or confirm the topic of a text.

3C616C28A11345E197174626F51A0A3E.description: With prompting and support, define the role of author and illustrator in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

1DC20072DA98411FBC1BC1D93571462F.description: Citing relevant and thorough evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development and interaction of individuals, ideas, and events in grade-level informational texts.

57762F228A32442E9E572BA07E1D3106.description: With prompting and support, identify key individuals, events, or pieces of information in an informational text.

157243AD64DC49DF944C01B2F4BBF5E0.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and key details in an informational text.

A38B0B03339943CEBABB6A6626E1C2DB.description: Citing relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development of themes or central ideas in grade-level informational texts.

DBA289F3BB574CD4A73F097613F0A14B.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

8F07C1CC367844F0B3E72EA1231A2E99.description: Read and comprehend complex, grade-level literary texts independently and proficiently.

4A2D8A38A2C04F49B1B1E0F077B3BC38.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

1128374EDD134E1083BD933AB61191B5.description: With prompting and support, make connections between own experiences and other cultures in literary texts.

0D6EF018714F418999AF4B63DFE6E83F.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a literary text.

A2C35F3D61BC44F3A85C7AC9A66360D3.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the experiences of characters in familiar stories.

344333DE0EDB45DFBB06386807945C6D.description: Citing relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate how an author's perspective or use of point of view shapes the style and meaning of grade-level literary text.

EBCB1E29D42F466B8E62F5F4C6871B02.description: With prompting and support, identify the basic characteristics of literary text.

702FFB0817DC4295B662AEDE25C49E15.description: With prompting and support, define the role of author and illustrator in a literary text.

6F0103AD04C94C1A9D0032F0E415552D.description: Citing relevant and thorough evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development and interaction of individuals, ideas, and events in grade-level literary text.

5F8511500341434D8B0726C0CA49F2CA.description: With prompting and support, identify main character(s), setting, and important events in a literary text.

E94EA7A21FAA4530ACA512D35FB6E196.description: With prompting and support, orally retell familiar stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

360359261380426DBAF47C90747ECCF8.description: Citing relevant and thorough textual evidence to support ideas, evaluate the development of themes or central ideas in grade-level literary texts.

B4326F5F71014C0192BC2AF129631ECD.description: Read grade level high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy (e.g. Fry or Dolch words or those included in instructional materials).

B19B1987A55A48E081C6794D8178A185.description: Read decodable consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words with automaticity and accuracy.

C3DA9D86877D4FFFBA15E65AD8FADA60.description: Recognize upper and lowercase letters automatically and accurately.

884D3616A284497089BF22626D4B031C.description: Develop accuracy, phrasing, and expression/prosody while reading a variety of grade-level texts to support comprehension.

09B00067413A46329B488CD8042DF48E.description: Read grade-level texts with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

A9C2501423A44EADB087CBCBB40AF640.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding (spelling) words.

7A6AEEE092DE45459541E0F733C54FC8.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

CB7BA5F15ADB4B7B83D48994351044FC.description: Demonstrate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

C670C5E2619A4D27B95807700B5C7580.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one sound to letter correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

6071BC59EF594A6FB7183DEB3D439D3C.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding (spelling) words.

9993920E8E6742958C78CA2955176E45.description: Demonstrate phonetic and word analysis knowledge and apply decoding skills to isolated words and in connected text.

8CFFC31EEAC34FE1A34D705068420A94.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in two- and three-phoneme (VC or CVC) words, excluding CVC words ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.

0EAD36B894EC4EE5AF050284A6F16324.description: Delete part of a syllable within a spoken word including compound words (e.g., "Say 'parsnip.' Say it again but don't say 'par;' e.g., "Say 'cowboy.' Say it again but don't say 'cow'").

E7D60DBFFF2F41E7BBC8065693706806.description: Blend onsets and rimes to form simple words (e.g., v-an, gr-ab).

B3498D5561FF4D67B59D819BC554E546.description: Count, produce, and segment spoken words into syllables and identify syllable parts.

437889ACA86F44A28679DCF7D1234134.description: Recognize and begin to produce oral rhymes.

D3D086B729C144BDA4FA61D268AA3D68.description: Segment and count spoken sentences into words.

8B38C053A6FB4F88851E4438A5C30F12.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

796DAC0A639D41199F615BE09DC2CDAA.description: Demonstrate phonological awareness through oral activities.

1E3C4D54EE0347C5AA4ACA3E39C4E227.description: Demonstrate knowledge that print reads from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

547D05802B444FC9BD81A5195BAB4988.description: Demonstrate understanding that words are separated by spaces in print; demonstrate understanding of one-to-one correspondence between voice and print.

49EBCF7A18664FC2920A242CA1AC108F.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters, and that print carries meaning.

F266F5BF3DD94560A8E73666C0F64F6E.description: Identify all upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet in isolation and in connected text.

014283E7DB6D4D79AF4B14B326916425.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the organization and basic concepts of print.

14569C5394DE4E98ABA2C355A2AC0E73.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the organization and basic concepts of print.
